meanings.definition: A large group of animals, especially hoofed mammals, that live, feed, or migrate together.
meanings.sent1: The herds of cows grazed peacefully in the meadow.
meanings.sent2: The herds of zebras traveled together across the savannah.
meanings.sent3: The herds of sheep decided to have a picnic in the field.
meanings.sent4: The herds of deer moved like a flowing river through the forest.
meanings.sent5: The herds of elephants trumpeted loudly as they marched through the jungle.

meanings.definition: To gather and move in a herd.
meanings.sent1: The shepherd herds the sheep into the pen for the night.
meanings.sent2: The rancher herds the cattle from one pasture to another.
meanings.sent3: The children herded together to play a game of tag.
meanings.sent4: The protesters herded towards the town square to make their voices heard.
meanings.sent5: The tourists herded onto the bus for the guided safari tour.

meanings.definition: To associate or move in a group.
meanings.sent1: The students herded around the teacher to ask questions after class.
meanings.sent2: The birds herded together on the power lines before migrating south.
meanings.sent3: The shoppers herded towards the sale section of the store.
meanings.sent4: The fans herded into the stadium to cheer for their favorite team.
meanings.sent5: The ants herded the aphids to protect them from predators.
